title: Scatterplot Application
question_text: For which of the following situations would a scatterplot best be used?

choices.text: Determining if a relationship exists between income and gender.
Determining if a relationship exists between race and political party.
Determining if a higher proportion of residents own guns in one state versus another.
Determining which state has the highest proportion of guns.
Determining if a relationship exists between income and height.

solution:
Scatterplots are used to determine if a correlation exists between two quantitative variables.

Remember quantitative variables are measured with numbers, such as one's weight, number of siblings, age, or ACT score.

On the other hand, categorical variables are measured with words and cannot be displayed on a scatterplot. Examples of categorical variables include favorite color, types of trees on your property, race, or favorite genre of music.

In this problem, income and height are two quantitative variables, so a scatterplot could be used to determine if any relationship exists.

A scatterplot can never be used to determine relationships between one or two categorical variables, rendering the other answer choices incorrect.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
